text: Theodore Van Kirk (February 27, 1921 - July 28, 2014) was an American military personal. He was the navigator of the United States Army Air Forces. He was best known as the navigator of the Enola Gay when they dropped the first atomic bomb on Hiroshima. Van Kirk was the last surviving member of the Enola Gay crew.
